page.title: 05Brickmaking
page.content: Brickmaking formed the major part of the working community of Rockland St.Mary in the last century.The brickyard,which was owned by the squire of Ashley Hall,was closed in the first year of World War II.It has 2 open-air kilns.Before this,in the eighteen-thirties the workers used to have to go to the pub in Claxton. This was too far away from the brick yard for the men to walk in their lunch-hour.To cater for this,a pub was built next to the brickyard.This was called the New Inn.Since the 1950's the pub has stopped serving redundant brickmakers and started catering for the tourists which now provides 90% of their trade.
